segments.text: I see the girl reaching up, her eyes full of hope, and it’s actually kind of sweet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just a kid, waiting for her brother to share a cookie with her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice how patient she’s being, not even touching the stool or rushing him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is taking a big risk, but he’s doing it for her, and that’s kind of nice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they’re both just trying to have a little fun, even if it’s a bad idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman at the sink is missing this little moment of sibling bonding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish she would turn around and see how happy they are, even if they’re breaking the rules.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still pouring, but the kids don’t seem to care about that at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but smile at the girl’s excitement, even though I know it’s not safe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they get their cookies before the stool tips over.
segments.speaker: PAR
